intro: Anonymos ciliata, commonly known as the hairy ciliate, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom during the warmer months. Anonymos ciliata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
